item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Dog Beaten to Death in Front of Owner, Beijing Magazine Reports
item.description: Beijing will probably see a harsher-than-usual drive against unregistered pet dogs this year because of rising rabies infections, vets are warning.
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: A dog lies in front of a wooden gate bearing posters with the Chinese for good fortune in a lane in Beijing.

item.title: Peace-Talk Critic Takes Lead in Colombia Presidential Vote
item.description: Óscar Iván Zuluaga failed to earn the majority needed to be declared the winner and will face President Juan Manuel Santos in a June runoff.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM NEUMAN
item.media:description: Voters in Bogota, Colombia looked for their name outside a polling station during the presidential elections on Sunday.

item.title: In Egyptian Town, Cheers for Sisi but Murmurs of Discontent
item.description: In Banha, north of Cairo, the presidential campaign banners for Abdel Fattah el-Sisi are everywhere but some have been defaced, illustrating both the certainty of his election and the challenges he will face.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: Boxes of presidential election ballots at a Cairo courthouse on Sunday.

item.title: In Russia, Tune Changes About Leader in Ukraine
item.description: As Petro O. Poroshenko emerged as the front-runner, attitudes toward the billionaire businessman began to shift and personal attacks ceased.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
item.media:description: Petro O. Poroshenko at a polling station in Kiev. The billionaire businessman was elected president of Ukraine on Sunday.

item.title: India Ink: Global Digital News Brands See Growth Opportunity in India
item.description: BuzzFeed, Huffington Post and Atlantic Media are among the companies with plans to build major online news operations in India, both on their own and with local partners.
item.dc:creator: By MAX BEARAK
item.media:description: A newspaper distributor in New Delhi sorted papers with news of the May election victory of Narendra Modi’s Bharatiya Janata Party.

item.title: In East, Separatists and Fear Stop Voters
item.description: Just 2 percent of registered voters in Donetsk are said to cast ballot, and Western observers said the election would be legal, even without turnout from the eastern provinces.
item.dc:creator: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and ANDREW ROTH
item.media:description: An anti-elections demonstration held in the eastern province of Donetsk, an area where pro-Russian separatists have vowed to do everything to prevent voting.

item.title: Damascus Journal: Once Bustling, Syria’s Fractured Railroad Is a Testament to Shattered Ambitions
item.description: The shutdown of the Hejaz railway station in Damascus reflects the lost links of business and society that once connected the region.
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:credit: Andrea Bruce for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Hejaz railway station in Damascus has become a museum popular with history buffs.

item.title: Lebanon Arrests Radical Cleric Who Backed Militants
item.description: Omar Bakri Muhammad, a Syrian-born cleric who preached for years in London, had expressed support for the extremist group Islamic State of Iraq and Syria.
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Omar Bakri Muhammad, a Syrian-born cleric who preached for years in London, had expressed support for the extremist group Islamic State of Iraq and Syria.

item.title: Press Battle in Pakistan Feeds Into Larger Conflict: Government vs. Military
item.description: A spat over the shooting of a talk show host, followed by the government’s reversal of a ban on the station, has exposed tensions between Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif and top officials.
item.dc:creator: By DECLAN WALSH
item.media:description: Employees of Geo News at a rally in Karachi, Pakistan. A news media spat over the shooting of a Geo talk show host has widened.

item.title: Fringe Groups Gain in European Voting
item.description: Preliminary reports from several countries, including the Czech Republic, Slovakia and Malta, suggested that voter interest had decreased compared with previous elections.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW HIGGINS and JAMES KANTER
item.media:description: A election official waited for voters to cast their ballots on Sunday in Massama, Portugal.

item.title: Obama Makes Surprise Trip to Afghanistan
item.description: The president did not meet with the departing Afghan leader, Hamid Karzai, instead focusing on talking to American service members about the coming withdrawal.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
item.media:description: President Obama spoke to troops during a surprise visit to Bagram Airfield in Afghanistan.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Back From Beyond: The D.S.K. Show
item.description: That some today see him as a potential savior, despite his many failings, says a lot about French politics.
item.dc:creator: By SYLVIE KAUFFMANN

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Sapping Europe's Energy Security
item.description: Dependence on Russian natural gas gives Vladimir Putin leverage to destabilize the West.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN RILEY

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q & A: Chan Koonchung on Tibet, Sex and Censorship
item.description: The author’s latest novel, “The Unbearable Dreamworld of Champa the Driver,” about a young Tibetan trying to find his way in Beijing, was published in English this month.
item.dc:creator: By JOYCE LAU
item.media:description: Chan Koonchung checking the offerings at the People's Recreation Community bookstore in Hong Kong.

item.title: Gen. Wojciech Jaruzelski, Solidarity’s Foil, Dies at 90
item.description: General Jaruzelski earned a villainous place in history when he suppressed Poland’s powerful Solidarity labor movement, but was later consoled by the idea that his reputation would improve.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL T. KAUFMAN and NICHOLAS KULISH
item.media:description: General Wojciech Jaruzelski in 1989..

item.title: Pro-European Businessman Claims Victory in Ukraine Presidential Vote
item.description: As voters cast their ballots to replace their toppled president, surveys showed the pro-Western billionaire Petro Poroshenko holding a wide lead over his strongest rival.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
item.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
item.media:description: People waited in Independence Square in Kiev, Ukraine, for the results of the country’s presidential election on Sunday.

item.title: Pope in Mideast, Invites Leaders to Meet on Peace
item.description: Wading into the heart of Middle East tensions, Pope Francis also endorsed “the State of Palestine” in symbolic visits to the West Bank and Jerusalem.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN, JIM YARDLEY and ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Pope Francis led a papal Mass on Sunday in Manger Square in Bethlehem.

item.title: Observers Go to Ukraine for Election Separatists Plan to Disrupt
item.description: An official from the unrecognized Donetsk People’s Republic said that his group had confiscated official voting center stamps and some ballots.
item.category: Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe
item.dc:creator: By SABRINA TAVERNISE

item.title: Chinese Flybys Alarm Japan as Tensions Escalate
item.description: The Japanese Defense Ministry said Chinese jet fighters had flown dangerously close to its reconnaissance planes in two separate incidents.
item.dc:creator: By MARTIN FACKLER

item.title: Thai Military Moves to Stifle Dissent and Tighten Grip
item.description: As protests grew in Thailand, the junta on Sunday warned citizens against opposing military rule and the coup leader said the military sought to “bring back happiness to all Thai people.”
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS FULLER and ERIC SCHMITT
item.media:description: An anti-coup protester stood in front of Thai army soldiers during a gathering in Bangkok on Sunday.

item.title: Suspects in China Market Attack Are Identified
item.description: Four of the men were killed when the two vehicles they used to mount the attack exploded in Urumqi, the capital of the western region of Xinjiang.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW JACOBS

item.title: Lebanon’s Political Standoff Leaves Leadership Vacancy
item.description: President Michel Suleiman’s term ended Saturday before the country’s political powers could agree on a successor, creating a vacuum of power in the deeply divided nation.
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: Michel Suleiman

item.title: For Crimea, It’s Russian Troops In, Tourists Out
item.description: With its economy flatlining, Crimea desperately needs a banner year in tourism. But with the violent portrait Russian television has painted of Ukraine, few seem likely to come.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:credit: James Hill for The New York Times
item.media:description: A public beach in Yalta, the Black Sea resort city in southern Crimea that is facing a tough summer if vacationers stay away.

item.title: Egypt’s New Strongman, Sisi Knows Best
item.description: Abdel Fattah el-Sisi’s cunning path to power and his paternalistic conviction that the people must be prepared to suffer are illuminated in interviews and leaked recordings.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: A banner for the soon-to-be-elected president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, displayed in Cairo in March.

item.title: Obama to Detail a Broader Foreign Policy Agenda
item.description: The president is expected to chart in a speech at West Point a middle course between isolationism and military intervention in international conflicts, from Syria’s civil war to Russia’s incursions in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER
item.media:description: President Obama, with Chancellor Angela Merkel on May 2, will reveal specifics of his foreign policy agenda on Wednesday.
